title: Zulfi for relief to masses amid COVID-19
content:
Attock, May 09 (APP):Special Assistant to the Prime Minister on Overseas Pakistanis Sayed Zulfikar Abbas Bukhari Saturday said the government was utilizing its all out resources to the vulnerable sections of society amid the corona pandemic.
He expressed these views during his surprise visit to an outlet of Utility stores Corporation (USC) in Fatehjang city. Deputy Commissioner Ali Annan Qammar and officials of USC were also present on this occasion.
On this occasion, the special assistant said it was the priority of the PTI government to provide relief to the masses. In this connection, he said, Prime Minister Imran Khan has approved a special package of Rs 50 billion for the USC to ensure provision of essential items including flour, ghee, sugar, rice and pulses to the people at reduced rates across the country through 4000 outlets of the USC.
He said the government would ensure a smooth supply of essential items across the country. “It is our utmost effort to provide special relief to the lower income and poverty stricken groups”, Zulfi added.
